page.title: 16SHELFORD-RELIGION-EVENTS
page.content: The church in Shelford is an Anglican church dedicated to St.Peter and St. Paul.The church was built on the site of an earlier Saxon church between 1250 and 1450. Services are held every Sunday evening and on the morning of every second Sunday in the month.The vicar is also vicar at the much bigger village of Radcliffe-On-Trent and is called the Rev.Kenneth Newcombe. There are 5 bells in the church which are rung every Sunday before the service by the experienced campanologists, the Mills family.The average attendance for services is 14 or 15 people,but once a year,29th June,there is a big festival to celebrate the feast day of St.Peter,when Shelford has a weekend 'feast'.On Saturday there are games and side shows and on Sunday the church is full for the service.
